section.title: About Template
section.para:
Web form designer
Template A template is an electronic document form used for the eformsign service. It is an e-document converted from existing paper forms such as applications, contracts, and agreements. You can create and upload templates in the eformsign service with its Web form designer or Form builder. For more information about the Form builder, please refer to Chapter 6 .

section.title: Overview of Template
section.para: To create and send electronic documents via eformsign, you have to create a template first which can be converted into an e-document.

para.emphasis: How to create a template with Web form designer

section.para: You can easily create a template by uploading a file online.

note.para: For more information about the Web form designer, please refer to

section.para: Convert the file you want to upload into a PDF file and upload it to the eformsign Web form designer.

listitem.para: Drag and drop the PDF file that you want to create as a template, or Select a file from My PC to select the file and upload it.
Select a component that you want to add and drag it on the uploaded file.
Adjust the size and position of the component.
Set the details in the property of the component.
View the document by clicking the Preview button.
Click the Save button after finishing form design and go to the Template settings.

section.para: You can set the details for the template to be created.

listitem.para: Set the template name, abbreviation, document name, document number, etc.
Assign members or groups to grant permission to use the template to create documents and to manage documents created by the template.
Sets the workflow for the document from its creation to completion.
Sets default values, and auto-filled values for fields.
Sets channels, recipients, or notification messages of the notification to send when requesting or notifying status of documents created from the template.

section.title: Overview of Workflow
section.para: Workflow A workflow is a document process from its creation to completion.
The workflow can be set in Template settings > Workflow for each template by a template manager.

The default workflow consists of Start and Complete steps. You can add as many of the steps as you like including Approver, Internal recipients, External recipients and create customized workflow for each template.

listitem.para: Step to request an approval of e-document to a member of your company.
Sending an e-document to a member of your company to review and sign.
Sending an e-document to a user outside of your company to review and sign.

para.emphasis: What is difference between Approval and Internal recipient step?

important.para: Both the approver and internal recipients can approve or reject the requested document, but internal recipients can designate the next person to process the document.
That is, internal recipients can designate external recipient, internal recipient, or approver after the Internal recipient step.

For example, if you do not specify an approval line for another department, and you want to request to another department for that document, you can specify a contact for that other department as an internal recipient step. When processing documents, personnel from other department can set up separate approval lines for that department to process documents.

section.title: Template settings
section.para: You can set the details for the template created with the uploaded file.

note.para: Only the Company administrator or Template manager can perform this action.
This work can be done in the PC, mobile, and application.

listitem.para: Set basic information about the template including the template name, category, validity period, and etc.
The template name will be displayed on the Manage Templates and New document menu pages.
Template Name should be 11 characters, including spaces. If the name is longer than 11 characters, you can see the full name by hovering the mouse over the name.
A short name that briefly describing the template. It is recommended to use two or three words.
Template abbreviation can be used in the document number, document name, mail template, etc. by entering $$.

Category is used to sort templates by type. With the category name, templates in the Manage templates and documents in Document box and Manage documents can be filtered. You can choose from an existing category or create a new category by entering a new name.
You can set multi-level categories with separator ( / ). For example, if you set the category HR Team/Vacation, the Vacation category in the HR category are created.
Enter additional comments about the template. This description is displayed in the list and at the bottom of the template name in New document.
Sets the time period in which documents can be created from this template. The start date is set to the uploaded date as a default and you can change the date.
When No expiry date is checked, the document can be created with out time limit. No expiry date is unchecked and set the date, the document can only be created until the set date.
Configure additional settings including document naming rules for documents created from the template.
Sets the document name when creating the document from the template. If a document naming rule is not set, the template name will be the document name.
You can add reserved words in the document name using $$ and {{.
If Allow document name change is checked, the document creator can change the document name.

Template
Generate a document number If Generate a document number is checked, documents are automatically numbered. Select the document number format that you want and when to be numbered.

section.title: General > Setting document naming rule
section.para:
In Template settings, you can set the document naming rule for which created by the template. Template
Document naming rules

You can make a piece of information entered into a document or document-related information to be automatically entered into the document name. If you set the document naming rule, then the document name is automatically entered based on the information of the document. As well, you can see this name in all document pages (In progress, Action required and Completed) and the Manage document page.

note.para: Only the Company administrator or Template manager can perform this action.

para.emphasis: How to set the document naming rule

figure.title: Template settings > Setting the document naming rule

listitem.para: In the sidebar menu, click Manage templates menu.

Click on the settings icon (
) of the desired template to go to the Template settings page.
Enter the desired naming rule in the Document naming rule field in the General tab.
Click the Save button on the top right corner to save the changes.

para.emphasis:
How to use reserved words Template
Reserved word

figure.title: Setting document naming rules using reserved words

listitem.para: This symbol adds a piece of information in the document into the document name.

Enter {{ in the Document naming rule field to display the list of Component IDs and then select the desired component ID. The information in that particular component will be added to the document name.
This symbol adds document-related information into the document name.
Enter $$ in the Document naming rule field to display the drop-down menu and then select the desired information.

The time in which the document is created (e.g. 02:59 pm)
The date and time in which the document is created (e.g. Feb 20, 2020, 02:59 pm)
The ID of the member who created the document
The name of the member who created the document
The department of the member who created the document

The template abbreviation entered in Template settings > General

The contact information entered in Manage company > Company profile

para.emphasis: Check the status of Allow document name change field.

tip.para: Even if the document naming rule is set, if the Allow document name change option is checked, the document creator can arbitrarily change the document name. If you do not want the document name to be changed, then make sure to untick the Allow document name change option.

section.title: General > Generating and viewing a document number
section.para: You can set a document number for documents created in eformsign. You can set to generate document number automatically for each template, and can select one of four document number formats. The document number can be entered within the document using the document component. You can also see a separate column in the document list and search documents by the document number.

para.emphasis:
Generating a document number Template
Generate a document number

note.para: Only the Company administrator or Template manager can perform this action.

listitem.para: In the sidebar menu, click Manage templates menu.

Click on the settings icon (
) of the desired template to go to the Template settings page.
Tick the Generate a document number checkbox in the General page.
Generated in the format of document creation order
Generated in the format of document creation year + document creation order
Generated in the format of template abbreviation + document creation order
E.g. Application 1, Application 2...
Generated in the format of template abbreviation + document creation year + document creation order
E.g. Application 2020_1, Application 2020_2...

para.emphasis: Choosing when to number a document

listitem.para: A number is generated when a document is start being created.
A number is generated when a document has been completed after going through all the steps in the workflow.
Click the Save button at the top right corner of the page to apply your changes.

section.para: A document number can be viewed on a document itself by using the document component and can also be viewed in the document list.

para.emphasis: Viewing a document number on the document itself

listitem.para: You can generate a document number on the document itself by using the document component.
Upload a PDF file to the Web form designer.
Add the document component in the desired location where the document number will be placed.
Click the Next button to go to the Template settings.
In Template settings > General, tick the Generate a document number checkbox.
Select a document number rule.
Click the Save button to save the settings.

para.emphasis: Viewing a document number in the Completed and Manage document

listitem.para: A document number can be viewed in the All documents menu (In progress, Action required, and Completed) and the Manage documents menu (requires document management permission).
In the sidebar menu, click and go to the Completed or Manage documents menu.
Click the column settings icon at the top right corner of the page.
Check Document number in the column list.
Check that the document number column is added.

para.emphasis: Searching for a document using a document number

listitem.para: You can search a document by its document number via advanced search.
Go to the Completed or Manage documents menu.
Click the Advanced button at the top right corner of the page.
Select Document number among the search condition.
Type in the word or number to be searched.
View the search results.

section.title: Set permissions
section.para: You can set the permissions for the template usage and document management.

Template usage This permission is to create documents using the template, and you can select Allow all or Group or member to allow all the members or some members in the company to create documents using the template.

Document management You can select groups or members to open documents created using the template, void completed documents, or remove documents permanently and these permissions can be set all or individually.

listitem.para: Open all documents (default): It is a default permission granted to a document manager regardless of selection, and it gives a permission to open all documents to the authorized groups or members.
Void completed documents (when selecting): Document management permission to approve voiding completed documents upon request of the document creator.
Remove documents (when selecting): Permission to permanently remove the document from the system

section.title: Workflow settings
section.para: You can create or modify workflow of the template by clicking Workflow tab in the Template settings page. Workflow

listitem.para: Go to the Workflow setting page by clicking the Workflow tab .

Click the add button (
) which is in between the Start and Complete step.
Select the type of recipient which you want to add.
When selected, a step is added to the workflow.

tip.para: You can add as many steps as you want to add. You can adjust order of steps by clicking the arrow next to a workflow step.
To delete a step, click X on the right side of the step button.

para.emphasis: Configuring details for each workflow step

section.para: You can click a step to set details such as properties and manage items for each workflow step.

listitem.para: Properties are to configure details of each step which are required including the step name.
In the Manage items tap, you can set fields to Allow access which allows recipient of the step to edit the fields, and Required field to make recipient to fill in the fields.

term.emphasis:
Start: Step to create a document. Workflow
Start

listitem.para: Step name(common): You can change the name of the step which is set to the default name.
Limit the number of documents : You can set the maximum number of documents that can be created from the template.

Create documents from URL : When requesting to an external user who are not a member, create a public link for external recipients that they can access directly via the URL and view the document without signing in to the eformsign service.
Do not allow duplicate documents: Prevents sending duplicate documents, and selects a field that determines whether a document is duplicated or not.

term.emphasis:
Approver: Step for requesting the approval of a document to the approver Workflow
Approver

listitem.para: Display name: Sets the name(text) to be displayed in the text box when requesting a document for an approval or external recipients. If you do not enter it, the default text will appear as shown below.

term.emphasis:
Internal recipient (member): Step for requesting document to be reviewed and signed to internal members of your company. Workflow
Internal recipient (member)

listitem.para: Recipient: Select the member to receive the document for this step.
Handler of a previous step: Select the member to receive the document among the internal recipients of the previous steps including the Start step. You can select a step.
Group and member: Set the document to be handled by one of the groups or members. You can select multiple groups or members.

term.emphasis:
External recipient: Step for requesting document to be reviewed and signed to external users who are not members of your company. Workflow
External recipients

listitem.para: Document expiration: Set URL link sent to external recipients to be expired after a period of time.

Automatically adds contacts: When requesting a document to an external recipient, you can set to add automatically the name and contact of the external recipient based on the information entered in the document.

Set password: You can set an verification password that external recipients must enter when viewing the document, such as the recipient's name, entered by the sender, or select a field in the document.
Password hint: You can set the help message that will be displayed when an external recipient enters a password to view the document.
Require mobile verification to review documents: Set external recipients to verify identity using mobile to open the document. This feature will incur an extra charge.

term.emphasis:
Complete: Step at which a document is finally completed. Workflow
Complete

listitem.para: Backup completed documents in external cloud storages: Sets the documents to be stored in an external cloud storage which is connected separately by the administrator or company manager.
Timestamp the document when completed: Sets the completed document to be timestamped which proves that the document remains unchanged since that time. This feature will incur an extra charge.

section.title: Field
section.para:
Template
Field In the Field menu, you can set default values or autofill values for fields in the template, and adjust the order of the fields.
You can set the default value for the field to be entered company/group/member information saved in Manage custom fields, or set to choose from a recent input value, or set to type in by the user.
You can save information that are frequently entered into a document in advance and set to be auto-filled.

For example, you can pre-save information about your company or group, such as department name, leader, representative number and information on document creator including name, contact details and etc. You can add items for related fields and set default values in Manage company > Manage custom fields

listitem.para: In the Manage custom fields screen, add a field.
Go to Manage templates menu.
Click the Template settings icon.
Go to the Field menu.
Enter a default value for the field that you want to set to be auto-filled.
After completing all the settings, click the Save button.

section.title: Notification settings
section.para:
Template
Notification settings You can select the method to send request or status notification message to recipients, view and edit the messages for documents created from the template.
Select the methods to send notifications to internal and external recipients. You can select either email or SMS or both.

note.para: SMS can only be selected by a company subscribed a paid plan and extra charges will apply.

section.para: When SMS is selected, Send via SMS and Send via SMS if failed to send via KakaoTalk are enabled.

listitem.para: Send SMS: Send a notification to recipients via SMS.
Send via KakaoTalk and if fails, send via SMS: Send a notification to recipients via KakaoTalk and to the recipient who does not use KakaoTalk, send via SMS.

section.para: You can view and edit notification messages that will be sent to recipients when requesting documents created from the template. Each notification template message is set as a default that is in Manage company > Notification template management page. Click the Edit button to edit the message directly.

note.para: SMS templates can only be edited by companies subscribed a paid plan.

listitem.para: When sending for review and sign > Internal: You can edit request notification messages sending to internal recipients when requesting for review and sign.
When sending for review and sign > External: You can edit request notification messages sending to external recipients when requesting for review and sign.
When sending for approval: You can edit the request notification message sending to approvers when requesting approval.
When rejecting documents: You can edit the request notification message sent to document requestors when a document is rejected by the approver, internal recipients, or external recipients.

section.para: You can select recipients of status notifications for documents created from the template and allows you to preview (notification for approve/review and create/reject/void/correct) or edit (notification sent when documents are completed) messages.

note.para: For the notifications sent when documents are rejected, voided, and corrected, only email templates are provided and they are not sent via SMS.
SMS templates for document completion notification (internal/external) can only be edited by companies subscribed a paid plan.
When Document creator option is checked and Step handler option is unchecked, a status notification is sent to the person who originally created the document.

When Document creator option is unchecked and Step handler option is checked, status notifications are sent to people who have processed the document before the current step, except the document creator.

When the options for Document creator and Step handler are both checked, status notifications are sent to both the document creator and the people who have processed the document before the current step.
When Document creator and Step handler options are both unchecked, no status notification of that step will be sent.

listitem.para: When documents are approved: When the document is approved by approver, a notification will be sent that the document has been approved.
When documents are reviewed and signed: When the documents are reviewed and signed by internal or external recipients, the notification will be sent that the document has been reviewed and signed.
When documents are rejected: When the document is rejected by approver, internal or external recipients, a notification will be sent that the document has been rejected.
Document void notification: When the request for voiding document is approved, a notification will be sent that the document has been voided.
When documents are corrected: When the document is corrected by document creator, a notification will be sent that the document has been corrected.
When documents are completed > Internal: When the document is completed, a notification will be sent to the document creator, approvers, and internal recipients that the document has been completed.
When documents are completed > External: When the document is completed, a notification will be sent to external recipients that the document has been completed.

note.para: When the Document creator option for When the document is completed > External is checked and external recipients create and submit a document via a URL, an information to receive a notification when the document is completed should be entered and the notification will be sent to the external recipients.

section.title: Menus for each template
section.para:
Go to Manage templates page, click the menu icon(
) right next to the template name to see the menus that can be set for each template.

listitem.para: Duplicate: Duplicates the template. The template's file and detailed settings for template are duplicated, and you can change and save the detailed settings.
Delete: Deletes the template. Once a template is deleted, you can no longer create a document from that template.
Deactivate: When a template is deactivated, it will not be shown in the New document page for other members.

Change owner: You can change the owner of the template. By default, the template owner is automatically assigned as the person who created the template. If you want to make changes later, you can change the owner to another member by clicking this menu. Template owners can be selected from members who have permission to manage templates.
Document Manager: You can select members or groups to manage the documents created from the template. You can also set the document manager in Template settings > Set permissions.

section.title: Search Templates
section.para: In Manage template page, you can lookup and search by template category.

listitem.para: Click the box to lookup templates by template status, category. Click X to return to view all categories.
Template is saved in the Sample category as a default. You can create a category in Template settings > General.
You can search templates by entering keywords such as template name and category name.
You can select the template sorting order in ascending or descending by template name or category.
